Key Match Events: Andrew Benintendi hit a two-run home run in the eighth inning
Post-Match Reflections: The White Sox suffered their 121st defeat of the season, surpassing the modern-day mark of 120 losses held by the expansion 1962 New York Mets
White Sox interim manager Grady Sizemore said the players'showed a lot this year' and that they 'can build from this. We can learn from this and get better.'
First baseman/designated hitter Gavin Sheets said, 'This is something that nobody can ever prepare for. And I think everybody in this clubhouse did an extremely good job of handling it.'

Infielder Nicky Lopez said, 'It’s been a tough year, but it’s one of those you’ve got to keep pushing forward and make the necessary adjustments this offseason and hope that next year’s a little bit different.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The White Sox topped the Tigers 4-0 on Saturday in front of a sellout crowd of 41,933, just their second victory in 12 chances in the season series
White Sox designated hitter Bryan Ramos hit a solo home run
White Sox starter Sean Burke followed a 2-hour, 20-minute rain delay with five scoreless innings
The Sox are 40-121 heading into Sunday’s season finale
